verses.verse: The oracle that the prophet Habakkuk saw.
The Prophet’s Complaint (Ps 13.1, 2; 22.1, 2) O LORD, how long shall I cry for help, and you will not listen? Or cry to you “Violence!” and you will not save?
(v 13|HAB 1:13; Jer 20.8) Why do you make me see wrongdoing and look at trouble? Destruction and violence are before me; strife and contention arise.
(Ps 22.12; 119.126; Isa 5.20) So the law becomes slack, and justice never prevails. The wicked surround the righteous; therefore judgment comes forth perverted.
(Isa 29.9, 14; Acts 13.41) Look at the nations and see! Be astonished! Be astounded! For a work is being done in your days that you would not believe if you were told.
(2 Kings 24.2; Jer 4.11-13; 5.15; 8.10) For I am rousing the Chaldeans, that fierce and impetuous nation, who march through the breadth of the earth to seize dwellings not their own.
(Isa 18.2, 7; Jer 39.5-9) Dread and fearsome are they; their justice and dignity proceed from themselves.

(Jer 4.13; 5.6; Ezek 17.3; Hos 8.1) Their horses are swifter than leopards, more menacing than wolves at dusk; their horses charge. Their horsemen come from far away; they fly like an eagle swift to devour.
(Hab 2.5) They all come for violence, with faces pressing (Meaning of Heb uncertain) forward; they gather captives like sand.
(2 Chr 36.6, 10; Isa 10.9; 14.16; Jer 32.24; Ezek 26.8) At kings they scoff, and of rulers they make sport. They laugh at every fortress and heap up earth to take it.
(Jer 2.3; 4.11, 12; Dan 4.30) Then they sweep by like the wind; they transgress and become guilty; their own might is their god!

(Deut 32.4; 33.27; Ps 90.2; Isa 10.5-7) Are you not from of old, O LORD my God, my Holy One? You (Or We) shall not die. O LORD, you have marked them for judgment, and you, O Rock, have established them for punishment.

(Ps 50.21; Isa 24.16; Jer 12.1, 2) Your eyes are too pure to behold evil, and you cannot look on wrongdoing; why do you look on the treacherous and are silent when the wicked swallow those more righteous than they?
(Eccl 9.12) You have made people like the fish of the sea, like crawling things that have no ruler.
(Ps 10.9; Jer 16.16; Am 4.2) He brings all of them up with a hook; he drags them out with his net; he gathers them in his seine, so he rejoices and exults.
Therefore he sacrifices to his net and makes offerings to his seine, for by them his portion is lavish, and his food is rich.
(Isa 19.8) Is he then to keep on emptying his net and destroying nations without mercy?
